turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Pierre-Joseph Redouté.
turn.1: What happened to the original drawings of Pierre-Joseph Redouté?
turn.2: Their whereabouts are virtually untraceable: in 1948 some were sold by Sotheby's in London and a few were acquired by the Hunt Institute for Botanical Documentation; later, single sheets have appeared repeatedly in auction.
turn.3: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.4: In 1985, 468 leaves were bought at a New York auction by an art dealer for approximately 5.5 million and then dispersed.
turn.5: Was there any exhibitions of his work?
turn.6: In the 20th and 21st century, numerous exhibitions in Europe, the Americas and Australia have been devoted to the work of Redouté.
turn.7: What can you tell me about the conservation efforts?
turn.8: The Biodiversity Heritage Library, the Library of Congress and other libraries have made many of his works accessible online and reproductions of his prints are available from virtually all print and poster shops.
turn.9: Did he receive any awards for his work?
